name: LabelKey
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
LabelKey
description: A collection of well-known label keys for trace spans.

methods.name: set_stack_trace
title: Google
Cloud
Trace
LabelKey.set_stack_trace
methods.description: Set the stack trace label in the given labels hash. The current call stack is formatted so the Stackdriver UI will display it.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/trace"

trace_record = Google::Cloud::Trace::TraceRecord.new "my-project-id"
span = trace_record.create_span "root_span"
Google::Cloud::Trace::LabelKey.set_stack_trace span.labels

params.name: labels
params.description:
The labels hash in which to set the stack trace
label value.

params.name: stack_frames
params.description: The current caller stack as returned from ::Kernel.caller_locations. If not set, ::Kernel.caller_locations is called internally.

params.name: skip_frames
params.description: Passed to the internal invocation of ::Kernel.caller_locations if one is needed.

params.name: truncate_stack
params.description: A procedure that allows skipping of the “topmost” stack frames. Stack frames, represented by instances of Thread::Backtrace::Location, are passed to this proc beginning with the topmost frame. As long as the proc returns a falsy value, those frames are dropped. Once the proc returns true for the first time, that frame and all remaining frames (possibly subject to filter_stack) are used. If not set, no frames are skipped.

params.name: filter_stack
params.description: A procedure that allows skipping of stack frames in the middle of the stack trace. After possibly skipping frames using truncate_stack, all remaining frames are passed to this proc as Thread::Backtrace::Location objects. Those for whom the proc returns a falsy value are skipped. If this parameter is not set, no filtering is done and all frames are presented in the stack trace.
